blocks.value: The Principalities (also called Princedoms or Rulers) are the seventh choir of angels. They watch over nations, cities, kingdoms, and large groups of people. Each nation and major community has a Principality assigned to guide and protect it according to God's plan.

The Principalities are responsible for the rise and fall of nations and kingdoms according to divine will. They inspire and guide leaders and influence events that affect large populations. While they work on a macro level with nations and societies, they ultimately serve God's plan for the salvation of individual souls within those communities.

These angels also oversee the work of the lower choirs, particularly in how angels assist the Church and spread the faith throughout the world. The Principalities teach us to pray for our nations, leaders, and communities. They remind us that God cares about the temporal order and that He works through nations and societies to accomplish His divine purposes. They inspire us to work for justice and the common good in our societies.
